args.pattern: and they check their own reflection

value.pattern: and they check their own reflection

an10.52:3.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udapatte sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno sace tattha passati rajaṁ vā aṅgaṇaṁ vā, tasseva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati.
an10.52:3.2.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, [38;5;121mand they check their own reflection[0m in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they see any dirt or blemish there, they’d try to remove it.

an10.51:3.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno sace tattha passati rajaṁ vā aṅgaṇaṁ vā, tasseva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati.
an10.51:3.2.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, [38;5;121mand they check their own reflection[0m in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they see any dirt or blemish there, they’d try to remove it.

an10.53:6.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udapatte sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno sace tattha passati rajaṁ vā aṅgaṇaṁ vā, tasseva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati.
an10.53:6.2.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, [38;5;121mand they check their own reflection[0m in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they see any dirt or blemish there, they’d try to remove it.

sn22.83:3.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso ānanda, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno upādāya passeyya, no anupādāya;
sn22.83:3.1.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, [38;5;121mand they check their own reflection[0m in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. They’d look because of grasping, not by not grasping.

an10.55:7.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udapatte sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno sace tattha passati rajaṁ vā aṅgaṇaṁ vā, tasseva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati.
an10.55:7.2.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, [38;5;121mand they check their own reflection[0m in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they see any dirt or blemish there, they’d try to remove it.

an10.54:2.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udapatte sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno sace tattha passati rajaṁ vā aṅgaṇaṁ vā, tasseva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati.
an10.54:2.2.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, [38;5;121mand they check their own reflection[0m in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they see any dirt or blemish there, they’d try to remove it.

dn10:2.29.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, māṇava, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno sakaṇikaṁ vā sakaṇikanti jāneyya, akaṇikaṁ vā akaṇikanti jāneyya.
dn10:2.29.1.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, [38;5;121mand they check their own reflection[0m in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they had a spot they’d know ‘I have a spot,’ and if they had no spots they’d know ‘I have no spots.’

mn15:8.3.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, itthī vā puriso vā, daharo yuvā maṇḍanajātiko, ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte, acche vā udakapatte, sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno, sace tattha passati rajaṁ vā aṅgaṇaṁ vā, tasseva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati;
mn15:8.3.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, [38;5;121mand they check their own reflection[0m in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they see any dirt or blemish there, they’d try to remove it.

mn77:33.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, udāyi, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno sakaṇikaṁ vā ‘sakaṇikan’ti jāneyya, akaṇikaṁ vā ‘akaṇikan’ti jāneyya;
mn77:33.2.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, [38;5;121mand they check their own reflection[0m in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they had a spot they’d know ‘I have a spot’, and if they had no spots they’d know ‘I have no spots’.

dn2:92.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, mahārāja, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno sakaṇikaṁ vā ‘sakaṇikan’ti jāneyya, akaṇikaṁ vā ‘akaṇikan’ti jāneyya;
dn2:92.1.en: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, [38;5;121mand they check their own reflection[0m in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they had a spot they’d know ‘I have a spot,’ and if they had no spots they’d know ‘I have no spots.’
